cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the Florida Panhandle, then forecast to arc northeast across Alabama-Georgia and into the Mid-Atlantic states
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle (near Panama City / Apalachicola, FL)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect; previous watches confined to Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Navarre, FL to the Wakulla/Jefferson County line, FL (Florida Panhandle)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle and Big Bend, then inland across Alabama, Georgia, the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic interior
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no New Jersey points listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible but tropical-storm-force winds unlikely at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for New Jersey in this event
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated higher amounts could reach New Jersey as the remnants pass mid-week
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized flash-flood risk in low-lying and urban areas due to heavy rain bands
